name: V&A Waterfront
description: The V&A Waterfront in Cape Town, South Africa is a bustling mixed-use destination built around the oldest working harbour in the Southern Hemisphere, with iconic Table Mountain as its dramatic backdrop. It’s one of Africa’s most visited attractions, known for its shopping, dining, entertainment, hotels, museums, and leisure activities — all set along scenic harbourside walkways overlooking the sea and mountains.
hours:

name: Table Mountain Aerial Cableway
description: The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is a popular cable car attraction in Cape Town that transports visitors from the lower slopes of Table Mountain to its flat-topped summit in about five minutes. Featuring rotating cabins that provide 360-degree views, the ride offers spectacular panoramas of the city, coastline, and surrounding mountains. It’s one of South Africa’s most iconic and visited experiences.
hours: {"raw": "First up 08:00 Last up 19:00 Last down 20:00", "friendly": null}

name: Zeitz MOCAA
description: The Zeitz Museum of Contemporary Art Africa (Zeitz MOCAA) is a world-class museum dedicated to contemporary art from Africa and its diaspora. Located at the V&A Waterfront in a strikingly redesigned historic grain silo, the museum features cutting-edge exhibitions across multiple floors, showcasing painting, sculpture, photography, and multimedia works. It is the largest museum of contemporary African art in the world and a major cultural landmark in Cape Town.
address: S Arm rd, Victoria & Alfred waterfront, cape town, 8001

name: Two Oceans Aquarium
description: The Two Oceans Aquarium is a family-friendly marine attraction located at the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town. It showcases the rich marine life found where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans meet, featuring exhibits such as a giant ocean tank, a living kelp forest, and interactive touch pools. The aquarium is known for its conservation efforts and offers an immersive experience highlighting South Africa’s diverse underwater ecosystems.
address: Dock Road, V&A Waterfront Cape Town

name: Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden
description: The Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden is a world-renowned botanical garden nestled on the eastern slopes of Table Mountain in Cape Town. Celebrated for its stunning landscapes and diverse collection of indigenous South African plants, it features scenic walking trails, the famous Boomslang canopy walkway, and seasonal open-air concerts. Kirstenbosch is considered one of the most beautiful botanical gardens in the world and a must-visit natural attraction in the city.
hours: {"raw": "The garden is open every day from 08h00 to 19h00 during summer (Sep-Mar), 08h00 to 18h00 during winter (Apr-Aug) The Conservatory is open every day from 09h00 to 17h00. The Curator’s Office is open Monday to Friday only, from 07h30-16h20, except on public holidays.", "friendly": null}

name: Robben Island Museum Tours
description: The Robben Island Museum is a historic site and museum located on Robben Island, just off the coast of Cape Town. Once used as a prison during apartheid, it is most famous for holding Nelson Mandela for 18 years. Today, it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site where visitors can tour the former prison, see Mandela’s cell, and learn about South Africa’s journey to freedom through guided tours often led by former political prisoners.

name: Cape Point Nature Reserve
description: The Cape Point Nature Reserve is a dramatic coastal conservation area located at the southern tip of the Cape Peninsula within the Table Mountain National Park. Known for its towering sea cliffs, rugged landscapes, and diverse wildlife, it offers scenic hiking trails, pristine beaches, and panoramic ocean views. Visitors can explore the historic lighthouse and experience the iconic meeting point of the Atlantic and Indian Oceans near the Cape of Good Hope.
address: Cape Peninsula, Simon's Town, 7995, South Africa

name: Boulders Beach Penguin Colony
description: The Boulders Beach Penguin Colony is a protected beach area near Simon’s Town, just outside Cape Town, famous for its colony of endangered African penguins. Part of Table Mountain National Park, the site features wooden boardwalks that allow visitors to observe the penguins up close in their natural habitat, surrounded by large granite boulders and clear turquoise waters. It is one of the few places in the world where you can see penguins living on a beach.

name: Camps Bay Beach
description: The Camps Bay Beach is one of Cape Town’s most popular and scenic beaches, known for its white sand, clear Atlantic waters, and stunning backdrop of the Twelve Apostles mountain range. Lined with palm trees, cafés, and stylish restaurants, it’s a favourite spot for sunbathing, sunset views, and vibrant beachfront dining.

name: Clifton 4th Beach
description: The Clifton 4th Beach is one of Cape Town’s most exclusive and picturesque beaches, famous for its soft white sand, turquoise waters, and sheltered setting between large granite boulders. Popular for sunbathing and swimming, it offers a quieter, more protected atmosphere compared to nearby beaches and is especially beautiful at sunset.

name: Sea Point Promenade
description: The Sea Point Promenade is a vibrant, scenic oceanfront walkway stretching along Cape Town’s Atlantic coastline. Popular with walkers, joggers, and cyclists, it offers panoramic sea views, landscaped gardens, public art, and outdoor fitness areas. The promenade is a favourite spot for both locals and tourists to enjoy sunrise or sunset strolls and the refreshing ocean breeze.

name: Chapman’s Peak Drive
description: Chapman's Peak Drive is a world-famous scenic coastal road that winds along the cliffs between Hout Bay and Noordhoek. Renowned for its breathtaking ocean vistas, dramatic cliffs, and winding curves, the drive offers multiple viewpoints for photography, picnics, and sunset watching. It’s considered one of the most spectacular coastal drives in the world.

name: DHL Stadium
description: The DHL Stadium, formerly known as Newlands Stadium, is a historic sports venue in Cape Town primarily used for rugby and cricket. Renowned as one of the oldest rugby stadiums in the world, it has a passionate fan atmosphere and hosts major domestic and international matches, offering views of the surrounding Table Mountain
address: Fritz Sonnenberg Road, greenpoint, cape town

name: Artscape Theatre Centre
description: The Artscape Theatre Centre is Cape Town’s premier performing arts venue, hosting a wide range of productions including theatre, ballet, opera, and concerts. Located in the city centre, the theatre features modern facilities, a large auditorium, and state-of-the-art acoustics, making it a key cultural hub for both local and international performances.
address: D.F. Malan street, foreshore, cape town

name: Baxter Theatre Centre
description: The Baxter Theatre Centre is a renowned cultural venue in Cape Town, known for presenting contemporary theatre, music, and dance performances. Situated in the suburb of Rondebosch, it combines a main theatre and studio spaces, supporting both professional productions and emerging local artists, making it a vibrant hub for performing arts in the city.

name: Canal Walk Shopping Centre
description: The Canal Walk Shopping Centre is one of the largest and most popular shopping malls in Cape Town. Located in the suburb of Century City, it features a wide range of local and international retail stores, a large food court, entertainment options, and ample parking, making it a prime destination for shopping, dining, and leisure activities.
address: 490 century blvd, century city, cape town

name: Old Biscuit Mill
description: The Old Biscuit Mill is a vibrant market and creative hub located in Woodstock, Cape Town. Housed in a renovated industrial building, it is famous for its weekend food market, artisanal products, local crafts, and design shops. The space also hosts events, exhibitions, and pop-up markets, making it a lively destination for food lovers, artists, and culture enthusiasts.
address: The Old Biscuit Mill 373-375 Albert Road, Woodstock, Cape Town.

name: Neighbourgoods Market (Woodstock)
description: The Neighbourgoods Market is a popular weekend market held at the Old Biscuit Mill in Woodstock, Cape Town. It features a wide array of fresh produce, gourmet foods, artisanal products, and craft beverages. Known for its lively atmosphere, live music, and vibrant community vibe, it’s a favourite destination for locals and tourists seeking quality food and unique shopping experiences.

name: Oranjezicht City Farm Market
description: The Oranjezicht City Farmers' Market is a weekly market located at Granger Bay near the base of Table Mountain in Cape Town. It focuses on fresh, locally sourced produce, artisanal foods, and sustainable products. The market is celebrated for its community atmosphere, healthy eating options, and support of local farmers and small businesses.
address: Cnr Granger Bay Boulevard and Dock Rd, V&A Waterfront, Cape town

name: MOJO Market
description: The Mojo Market is a lively indoor market and dining destination located in Sea Point, Cape Town. It features a variety of food stalls, craft beverages, retail shops, and live entertainment. Known for its vibrant atmosphere, Mojo Market is a popular spot for locals and tourists to enjoy casual dining, artisanal products, and social gatherings.
address: 30 Regent Road, Sea Point, Cape Town

name: Bay Harbour Market (Hout Bay)
description: The Bay Harbour Market is a bustling weekend market located in Hout Bay, Cape Town. It offers a mix of artisanal foods, crafts, fashion, and live music, creating a vibrant and lively atmosphere. The market is popular for its diverse culinary offerings, local art, and community vibe, making it a favourite destination for both locals and visitors.

name: Woodstock Exchange
description: The The Woodstock Exchange is a creative hub in the Woodstock district of Cape Town. Housed in a renovated industrial building, it features boutique shops, design studios, artisanal retailers, cafés, and event spaces. The Woodstock Exchange is known for fostering local creativity and innovation, making it a vibrant destination for shopping, dining, and cultural experiences.

name: Woodstock Foundry
description: The Woodstock Foundry is a contemporary creative and retail space in Woodstock, Cape Town. Set in a converted industrial building, it houses art studios, design shops, artisanal stores, and cafés. The venue is a hub for local artists and makers, offering visitors a unique blend of shopping, dining, and cultural experiences in a vibrant, urban setting.

name: Greenmarket Square Market
description: The Greenmarket Square Market is a historic outdoor market located in the heart of Cape Town’s city centre. Famous for its vibrant stalls selling crafts, souvenirs, jewelry, and artwork, it has been a hub for local traders and artisans for centuries. The market offers a lively atmosphere and is a popular spot for tourists looking to experience Cape Town’s culture and pick up unique, handcrafted items.

name: Merchants on Long
description: The Merchants on Long is a stylish retail and dining destination located on Long Street in Cape Town’s city centre. Housed in a historic building, it features boutique shops, artisanal food outlets, and cafés, blending contemporary design with heritage architecture. It’s popular for its vibrant atmosphere, curated shopping, and social spaces.

name: AKJP Concept Store
description: The AKJP Concept Store is a contemporary retail space in Cape Town showcasing a curated selection of fashion, lifestyle, and design products. Known for supporting local designers and emerging brands, the store blends innovative design with unique, high-quality merchandise, offering visitors a stylish and modern shopping experience.

name: Pichulik Jewellery Atelier
description: The Pichulik Jewellery Atelier is a boutique studio and flagship store in Cape Town, known for its distinctive, handcrafted jewelry. Celebrated for bold, sculptural designs inspired by African heritage and contemporary aesthetics, Pichulik creates pieces that blend artistry, cultural storytelling, and modern craftsmanship. The atelier offers visitors a chance to explore collections, custom pieces, and the brand’s unique creative process.
address: 8 Watson Street (just off of Bree Street), cape town

name: Truth Coffee Roasting
description: The Truth Coffee Roasting is a renowned specialty coffee shop and roastery located in Cape Town’s city centre. Famous for its artisanal coffee, steampunk-inspired interior, and commitment to quality roasting, it offers a unique café experience. Truth Coffee is celebrated both locally and internationally for its innovative brewing techniques, carefully sourced beans, and vibrant café atmosphere.

name: Rosetta Roastery
description: The Rosetta Roastery is a specialty coffee roastery and café located in Cape Town. Known for its carefully sourced beans, precision roasting, and artisanal brewing methods, Rosetta Roastery offers a refined coffee experience. It emphasizes quality, sustainability, and craftsmanship, attracting coffee enthusiasts seeking expertly prepared espresso and filter coffees.
address: 97 Bree st, Corner of Bree & Shortmarket st, Cape Town

name: Origin Coffee Roasting
description: The Origin Coffee Roasting is a specialty coffee roastery and café in Cape Town, celebrated for its high-quality, ethically sourced beans and artisanal roasting techniques. It focuses on precision brewing, from espresso to pour-over, offering a refined coffee experience. Origin Coffee Roasting is popular among coffee aficionados for its dedication to flavor, craftsmanship, and sustainable sourcing.

name: Ground Art Caffe
description: The Ground Art Caffe is a trendy café in Cape Town known for its specialty coffee, artisanal beverages, and relaxed, creative atmosphere. It combines high-quality coffee brewing with a focus on artful presentation and a welcoming space, making it a popular spot for locals and visitors to enjoy coffee, light meals, and a casual social environment.

name: The Ladder on Bree
description: The The Ladder on Bree is a contemporary café and lifestyle spot located on Bree Street in Cape Town. Known for its specialty coffee, artisanal food offerings, and stylish, inviting interior, it serves as a social hub for locals and visitors. The venue emphasizes quality, creativity, and a relaxed atmosphere, making it a popular destination for dining and casual gatherings.
address: 136 Bree St, Cape Town City Centre, Cape Town, 8001

name: Jason Bakery
description: The Jason Bakery is a popular artisanal bakery and café in Cape Town, celebrated for its freshly baked breads, pastries, and specialty coffee. Known for high-quality ingredients, innovative flavors, and a casual, inviting atmosphere, it attracts both locals and tourists looking for a relaxed spot to enjoy breakfast, brunch, or a coffee break.

name: Kleinsky’s
description: The Kleinsky's is a well-known bakery and café in Cape Town, famed for its freshly baked breads, pastries, and artisanal coffee. Praised for its quality ingredients and traditional baking techniques, Kleinsky's offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere, making it a favourite destination for breakfast, brunch, or a casual coffee stop.

name: Starlings Café
description: The Starlings Café is a charming café in Cape Town known for its specialty coffee, fresh pastries, and relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. It emphasizes quality ingredients and artisanal preparation, making it a popular spot for breakfast, brunch, or casual coffee breaks among locals and visitors alike.

name: Bootlegger Coffee (Sea Point point mall)
description: The Bootlegger Coffee Company is a popular café and coffee roastery in Cape Town, renowned for its specialty coffee, casual atmosphere, and high-quality espresso and filter coffee offerings. With multiple locations across the city, Bootlegger combines artisanal coffee with freshly prepared meals and pastries, making it a favourite spot for both locals and tourists seeking a relaxed café experience.

name: Yours Truly (Kloof Street)
description: The Yours Truly Kloof Street is a stylish café and restaurant in Cape Town’s Kloof Street district. Known for its artisanal coffee, gourmet breakfast and brunch offerings, and elegant yet relaxed ambiance, it provides a popular spot for both locals and visitors to enjoy high-quality food and beverages in a welcoming, contemporary setting.

name: La Colombe (waterfront)
description: The La Colombe is a world-renowned fine-dining restaurant located in Cape Town. Celebrated for its innovative contemporary cuisine, exceptional service, and elegant setting, La Colombe consistently ranks among South Africa’s top restaurants. It offers creative tasting menus that blend global flavors with local ingredients, making it a destination for gourmet food enthusiasts.

name: The Pot Luck Club
description: The The Pot Luck Club is a modern, fine-dining restaurant located in the Old Biscuit Mill in Woodstock, Cape Town. Known for its innovative small-plate sharing concept, it offers bold, globally inspired flavors and artful presentations. The Pot Luck Club is celebrated for its vibrant atmosphere, panoramic views of the city, and inventive culinary experiences.
address: Silo Top Floor, the old biscuit mill, 373-375 Albert Road, woodstock

name: Belly of the Beast
description: The Belly of the Beast is a popular butcher shop and restaurant in Cape Town known for its high-quality, locally sourced meats and house-made charcuterie. It emphasizes artisanal butchery, sustainability, and bold flavors, offering both retail cuts and cooked dishes. The venue has gained a reputation for creative meat-focused dining and exceptional quality in a casual yet stylish setting.

name: Utopia Cape Town
description: The Utopia Cape Town is a rooftop restaurant and lounge located in Cape Town’s city centre. Known for its modern design, panoramic views of Table Mountain and the city, and vibrant atmosphere, Utopia offers a mix of contemporary cuisine, cocktails, and entertainment. It’s a popular spot for dining, socializing, and enjoying sunsets in a stylish urban setting.

name: Black Sheep Restaurant
description: The Black Sheep Restaurant is a contemporary eatery located in the vibrant Gardens district of Cape Town. Known for its innovative, seasonal menu, relaxed yet stylish atmosphere, and focus on locally sourced ingredients, Black Sheep offers a creative dining experience that combines modern cuisine with a casual, welcoming setting.

name: Kloof Street House
description: The Kloof Street House is a stylish restaurant and bar located in a Victorian-era house on Kloof Street, Cape Town. Known for its eclectic décor, intimate ambiance, and inventive menu blending local and international flavors, it offers a unique dining experience. The venue is popular for both casual meals and special occasions, combining a cozy, historic setting with contemporary cuisine.

name: Chef’s Warehouse (Bree Street)
description: The Chefs Warehouse Bree Street is a contemporary fine-dining restaurant in Cape Town’s Bree Street district. Famous for its small-plate tasting menus, innovative dishes, and focus on seasonal, high-quality ingredients, it offers a modern, interactive dining experience. The restaurant is celebrated for bold flavors, creative presentation, and an intimate, vibrant atmosphere.

name: Grub & Vine (bree street)
description: The Grub & Vine is a casual dining restaurant in Cape Town known for its relaxed atmosphere, hearty meals, and selection of wines and craft beverages. It focuses on quality, locally inspired dishes and is popular for brunch, lunch, and social gatherings, offering a welcoming spot for both locals and visitors to enjoy food and drinks in a friendly setting.

name: SeaBreeze Fish & Shell
description: The Seabreeze Fish & Shell is a popular seafood restaurant in Cape Town, known for its fresh fish, shellfish, and coastal-inspired dishes. Offering a relaxed, casual dining atmosphere, it emphasizes locally sourced ingredients and traditional seafood preparations, making it a favourite spot for both locals and tourists seeking authentic Cape Town seafood experiences.

name: Addis in Cape Ethiopian
description: The Addis in Cape Ethiopian Restaurant is an Ethiopian dining spot in Cape Town that offers traditional Ethiopian cuisine in a warm and inviting atmosphere. Known for its authentic flavors, injera-based dishes, and communal dining style, it provides a cultural culinary experience highlighting the rich tastes and traditions of Ethiopia.

name: Ethiopian Madam Taitou
description: The Ethiopian Madam Taitou is an Ethiopian restaurant in Cape Town known for its authentic cuisine, vibrant flavors, and traditional dining experience. It specializes in injera-based dishes, stews, and vegetarian options, offering guests a genuine taste of Ethiopian culinary culture in a welcoming, culturally rich atmosphere.

name: Marco’s African Place
description: The Marco’s African Place is a Cape Town restaurant celebrated for its authentic African cuisine and warm, inviting atmosphere. Specializing in dishes inspired by various African culinary traditions, it offers hearty meals, traditional flavors, and a vibrant dining experience that reflects the continent’s diverse food culture.

description: The Bo-Vine Wine & Grill is a contemporary restaurant and wine bar in Cape Town, known for its expertly grilled meats, curated wine selection, and relaxed yet stylish atmosphere.
